nodes.description: Lal Shahbaz Qalandar's shrine in Sehwan city of Jamshoro was attacked on Thursday evening, killing dozens and leaving hundreds injured.
nodes.support_text: The attack on Lal Shahbaz Qalandar's shrine in Sehwan city of Jamshoro took place Thursday evening, killing dozens and leaving hundreds injured.

nodes.description: Locals protested against the police for not providing enough security at the shrine after the attack.
nodes.support_text: After the attack, bereaved locals protested against the police for not providing enough security at the shrine despite the whole country being in a sensitive situation.

nodes.description: Bereaved locals complained that remains of blast victims were thrown by a drain in Sehwan.
nodes.support_text: Locals had also complained of remains of blast victims being thrown by a drain in Sehwan.

nodes.description: Sindh Chief Minister Syed Murad Ali Shah visited the city to address the issue of remains being thrown by a drain.
nodes.support_text: The issue was taken up by Sindh Chief Minister Syed Murad Ali Shah who had later visited the city.

nodes.description: Initial reports suggested the attacker was dressed in burqa, but later CCTV footage showed a man managing to dodge security without being frisked.
nodes.support_text: Initial reports had suggested the attacker was dressed in burqa. However, later a CCTV footage showed a man managing to dodge his way in the shrine, without letting the policeman deployed on the point frisk him.

nodes.description: Sindh IG A D Khawaja stated there was a 99% chance the man in the CCTV footage was the suicide bomber who blew himself up in the shrine.
nodes.support_text: While talking to the media on Sunday, Sindh IG A D Khawaja said there were 99% chances the man shown in the CCTV footage was the suicide bomber who blew himself in the shrine.

nodes.description: Reports revealed the attacker was affiliated with the Hafeez Brohi group, a network of terrorists in Sindh working to activate Daesh in the region.
nodes.support_text: Reports have also revealed the attacker was affiliated with Hafeez Brohi group, a network of terrorists in Sindh that is said to be working to activate Daesh in the region.

nodes.description: It was found that the suicide jacket worn by the attacker was made in Shikarpur.
nodes.support_text: It was also found out that the suicide jacket worn by the attacker was made in Shikarpur.

nodes.description: The death toll of the Sehwan blast rose to 90 as two victims succumbed to their injuries on Monday.
nodes.support_text: The death toll of Sehwan blast has risen to 90 as two victims succumbed to their injuries on Monday.

edges.support_text: After the attack, bereaved locals protested against the police for not providing enough security at the shrine despite the whole country being in a sensitive situation.

Initial reports had suggested the attacker was dressed in burqa. However, later a CCTV footage showed a man managing to dodge his way in the shrine, without letting the policeman deployed on the point frisk him.
The death toll of Sehwan blast has risen to 90 as two victims succumbed to their injuries on Monday.
Locals had also complained of remains of blast victims being thrown by a drain in Sehwan.
The issue was taken up by Sindh Chief Minister Syed Murad Ali Shah who had later visited the city.
While talking to the media on Sunday, Sindh IG A D Khawaja said there were 99% chances the man shown in the CCTV footage was the suicide bomber who blew himself in the shrine.
Reports have also revealed the attacker was affiliated with Hafeez Brohi group, a network of terrorists in Sindh that is said to be working to activate Daesh in the region.
It was also found out that the suicide jacket worn by the attacker was made in Shikarpur.
